data.name: Start Tech Confluence - Startup Summit
data.description:
On the day of 25th March Saturday, there will be around 10 Startups (who are solving real time problems and making everyday lives of people better) and around 100 participants coming in from various fields & backgrounds. So this would be a confluence where 10 Startups meet 100 Particpants to solve real world problems. Imagine that kind of electric & energetic environment where in a real war of minds converge to discuss the solution & help validating the same. 

What will exactly happen ?

- Every startup will be given 40 - 50 minutes slot of time, where in you will be interacting with them.
- These startups will pitch what they do from both a business & technical point of view
- They will explain their problem statement, that they would like to put to open discussion in the confluence
- this would be followed by a short session where in the participants, i.e, Problem Solver ( YOU ) will interact with them through a series of discussions, brain storming sessions/ Group discussions or other activities for validation.

Who can participate ?

- Those who love to solve a challenging real industrial problem and enjoy that minute of extreme happiness
- Startup Enthusiasts
- Engineers & Researchers who are in search of real world problems
- Business Development Quirks & Hustlers
- Freelancers
- Students who want to experience & know what happens in the industry
- Tech Geeks

Why should one attend this?

- Know the industrial standards & real world problems
- Understand the current scenario of startup ecosystem
- Provide solutions & if its impressive, you may win Internships* ( for students ), deals/projects ( for freelancers) and unlimited networking & learning for all!
- And lots of goodies & swag from companies!

* Unlimited Internships, provide the best solutions for all 10, who knows, you will walk away with offers from all 10 !

Register now for Participation!

data.name: DBMania
data.description:
Hi masters of technology! B-)
Here's a preview for the main event. Starting from 18th March, 3 to 4 questions will be posted on each day. Text us your answers. Leader board will be maintained and top scorers at the end of the event stand a chance to win exciting goodies @ aBaCUS'17! :D 
Register yourself at www.abacus.org.in before you begin! :)
Rules and Format:
1) aBaCUS id is a MUST.
2) Questions will be posted at 5.00 PM everyday.
3) Send your answers to +91 9655883077.
4) Message format should be:
Name
College Name
aBaCUS id (MUST)
department, year
(finally :P) your answer!
5) Scores will be awarded based on speed and correctness of your answer.
6) Only the first answer from a participant will be counted. 
7) Anybody who comments the answer will be disqualified from further rounds.
8) Updated Leader board will be uploaded on the next day at 10.00 AM
Get ready to play the tech-fusion!

data.name: Sherlock - Online Event
data.description:
“Brilliant! Four serial suicides and now a note! It’s Christmas!”
-Sherlock
Can you empathise with this? Whether solving crimes is your version of an afternoon nap or you just really like a certain high functioning sociopath, Kurukshetra's Sherlock has got you covered!

data.name: Debugging
data.description: Debugging is twice as hard as writing the code in the first place. Prove your skills in seeking the bugs, racing against time and your peers to be crowned the ultimate grand master of debugging.

data.name: Battle Lit Out
data.description: Are you interested in writing, speaking, and quizzing? Are there so many events you want to attend, and you can’t decide? Then this is the right event for you! Battle Lit Out encompasses all the different events generally conducted by the Literary Club.

data.name: Kollywood Quiz
data.description: A mind sport where participants are tested on how quickly and accurately they can answer questions related to anything and everything on Kollywood.

data.name: STATE OF CHAOS:
data.description:
A  STRESS MANAGEMENT EVENT

NON TECHNICAL EVENT:
The event consists of TWO rounds:
Only those participants qualifying from round one are allowed to proceed to the next round.
Name of round 1- SHIPWRECK
 Game contents: 
You are in a wrecked ship, stranded in a deserted island. A fisherman in his boat is willing to save just one person from your ship. Each of the contestants will be given a celebrity or well-known person and the participant must think themselves as that personality and have to justify why they need to be saved. 

RULES:
1)	Individual participation only.
2)	The participant will be given a preparation time of 5 minutes.
3)	 The participant will then be allowed to present his/her arguments, for not more than 2 minutes. (Including interruptions).
4)	 The judges may interrupt the participant at any time to counter their arguments.
5)	 The language of communication is only English.
6)      Occasional usage of any other language is fine.
7)	The participant will be judged based on clarity, content, inventiveness, wit and humour.
8)	In case of a tiebreaker the participants will again be given a new personality.
9)	Judges’ decision is final.

Round 2: STATE OF CHAOS
Game contents:
Each of the participant will be given a difficult or weird scenario and he/she should manage that situation. It is basically a stress management event.
For example: Your team has not completed the given task on time. As you are the team leader, your project manager yells at you for the incompetence of the team and your project mates blame you for the delay in project delivery.  You have to manage them all, while maintaining your cool. 

RULES:
1)	Each participant will be given a different scenario.
2)	The topic/ scenario will be given on spot. 
3)	The coordinators or organisers will act as the trouble makers for 1 minute.
4)	Each participant will be given only 1 minute at the end to manage or calm down the situation at the end. 
5)	The participant is allowed to convey only in English.
6)	The participant must remain calm till the end.
7)	The participant will be judged based on their attitude towards the situation and how he handles it.
8)	Judges’ decision will be final.

For further details contact:
Keshav- 9487501064

data.name: Vujade 2015
data.description:
Brains + Map + Race = VUJADE !
The high energy , citywide Treasure Hunt organised by LAKSHYA the Entrepreneurship  Development Cell of SSN College of Engineering. Use your brains , perform simple tasks ,show off your NAMMA CHENNAI knowledge and RACE THE CITY!!!

Register at  http://ssnlakshya.in/vujade/registrations.php

data.name: The T+ Run
data.description:
An unprecedented run organised by students of Anna University to aid Project LEAP, an initiative by Becoming I Foundation as a part of Techofes+, a Techofes 2015 Social Outreach initiative.

Project LEAP is a one-of-a-kind project which aims to change the way primary education happens in low income classrooms.

Day and Date: Sunday, 01-02-2015
Distances: 6KM  |  10KM
Venue: CEG, Anna University
Assembly time: 05:00 AM

Register at: plus.techofes.in/run

data.name: GUEST LECTURES at Kurukshetra 2015
data.description:
Kurukshetra has a reputation. A reputation for featuring lectures from the most prominent figures of their respective field. A reputation that has been hard-earned and will only be heightened this year. Our line-up for K!15 will leave you as excited as we are. 

Here’s the schedule

DAY 1- Jan 29th

Ashok Krish-Head of Social Media and Workplace Re-imagination Practice, TCS

TOPIC-“TICK TOCK TECH”
VENUE-Tag Auditorium
TIME-10.45 am


A. Muruganantham-Inventor of low-cost sanitary napkin making machine

TOPIC-“Why I wore a Sanitary Napkin: My Passion Towards Social Entrepreneurship”
VENUE-Tag Auditorium
TIME-2.45 pm


DAY 2- Jan 30th

S. Somasegar-Corporate Vice-President of the Developer Division, Microsoft, USA

TOPIC-“JOURNEY TO THE CLOUDS”
VENUE-Tag Auditorium
TIME-10.45 am


V. Ponraj-Scientist, DRDO and scientific advisor to Dr. Abdul Kalam

TOPIC-“A MANIFESTO FOR CHANGE”
VENUE-Colin McKenzie Hall
TIME-2.45 pm


DAY 3- Jan 31st

Dr. V. Adimurthy-Mission Concept Designer, Mars Orbiter Mission, ISRO

TOPIC-“Our Journey to the Red Planet: Mars Orbital Mission and Beyond”
VENUE-IST Auditorium/Ada Lovelace Auditorium
TIME-10.45 am


Dan Burns-Physicist and Faculty Scholar at Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory

TOPIC-“The Science of Interstellar: Journey Through a Wormhole”
VENUE-Tag Auditorium
TIME-2.45 pm
